writing_prompt: Every morning, Will Solace wakes up next to Nico di Angelo, the love of his life, and every morning begins with laughter, kisses, and the occasional battle to get out of bed—until one day, Nico suggests something that changes their routine forever.
story:
I woke up to the sound of Nico's laughter, his warm breath tickling my ear as he whispered, "Morning, zombie." I groaned dramatically, flopping back onto the pillows like a defeated hero. "You're a vampire, Nico. You're supposed to be the one sleeping all day, not me." Nico chuckled, his fingers dancing across my chest as he teased, "Someone has to keep you in line, Will."

Our morning banter was a well-rehearsed dance, a comfortable routine that never failed to leave me smiling. We'd trade playful jabs, each one more ridiculous than the last, until we finally managed to drag ourselves out of bed. This morning was no exception, except for the fact that Nico seemed...different. His eyes sparkled with an extra dose of mischief, and his grin was a fraction wider than usual.

As we stumbled into the kitchen, Nico announced, "I have a proposal." I raised an eyebrow, intrigued despite myself. "What kind of proposal?" Nico's grin grew, and he started tapping his foot to an invisible beat. "I think we should start a morning dance-off."

I blinked. "A dance-off?" Nico nodded enthusiastically. "Yeah! We can pick a song, and whoever comes up with the best moves gets to choose the coffee flavor for the day." I stared, aghast. "You want me to dance before coffee? Are you trying to kill me?"

Nico chuckled, unfazed. "Come on, Will. It'll be fun! We can do the floss, or the Renegade—"

I cut him off, throwing up my hands in mock horror. "The Renegade? You want me to Renegade my way into the day? Have you seen my moves? I'm a demigod, not a backup dancer for BTS!"

Nico's laughter was infectious, and I found myself grinning despite my initial resistance. As we picked a song and started dancing, our kitchen was transformed into a ridiculous, wonderful dance floor. I spun, I twirled, and I definitely face-planted into the counter at one point (Nico won that round).

But as we laughed and stumbled through our morning dance-off, something shifted. It was no longer just about the coffee flavor or the silly dance moves—it was about the way Nico's eyes sparkled when he laughed, the way his smile made me feel like I was home.

As we finally collapsed onto the couch, panting and giggling, Nico turned to me with a mischievous glint in his eye. "You know, I think this might just become our new morning routine." I raised an eyebrow, still catching my breath. "You're insane, di Angelo."

Nico just grinned, snuggling into my side. "That's why you love me, Solace."

As we settled into our new routine, our mornings became a joyful, chaotic mess of music and laughter. We danced, we spun, and we face-planted our way into the day, side by side. And I realized that sometimes, it's the unexpected moments that bring us closer, that make our love shine brighter.

As we sipped our coffee, Nico turned to me with a smile. "You know, I think this dance-off thing might just be the best idea I've ever had." I rolled my eyes, smiling. "I'm not sure if I should be impressed or terrified."

Nico just chuckled, his eyes sparkling with amusement. "Maybe a little bit of both, my love."

writing_prompt: Your partner insists you can look through their phone anytime, but when you do, you discover a collection of candid photos of yourself—each one capturing a moment you didn’t even realize was special.
story:
I flopped onto the couch, snatching Will's phone from his hand as he chuckled. "Hey, I thought we had an open phone policy?" I teased, grinning mischievously.

Will rolled his eyes good-naturedly. "We do, we do. I'm just worried you'll find all the selfies I take with my cat, and never look at me the same way again."

I laughed, scrolling through his phone. That's when I saw them – a collection of photos, each one featuring me as the main attraction. My eyes widened in surprise, and I felt a flush rise to my cheeks. "Will, what's going on here? You're a secret paparazzo, aren't you?"

Will burst out laughing, nearly spitting his coffee out his nose. "What? No, I just... I like taking pictures of you, okay? You're my favorite subject."

I raised an eyebrow, scrolling through the photos. There was one of me reading a book, completely absorbed in the story, with a look of intense focus on my face. Another caught me laughing, eyes crinkled, with the sun setting behind me, painting the sky in hues of pink and orange. I felt a pang in my chest, realizing these were moments I hadn't even realized were special.

As I continued scrolling, I couldn't help but giggle at the silly faces I made, and the way Will had captured my "thinking face" – a rare sight, indeed. "You caught me in my natural habitat!" I exclaimed, pointing to a photo of me lounging on the couch, surrounded by snacks and video games.

Will chuckled, leaning over to peer at the screen. "That's my favorite one. You look so adorable when you're gaming."

I playfully hit him on the arm. "Hey, I'm a serious gamer, thank you very much."

The soft glow of the evening sun filtering through the curtains cast a warm, golden hue over the room as we sat together, reminiscing about each moment captured in the photos. Will gently brushed a stray hair from my face, his fingers grazing my skin, sending shivers down my spine.

As we delved deeper into the album, I realized these candid shots were more than just funny moments – they were a behind-the-scenes look at our relationship. They showed the quiet moments, the laughter, and the adventures we shared. It was like flipping through a photo album, but instead of posed smiles, these were genuine, unguarded moments.

I never knew Will saw me like this. I never knew these moments mattered so much. But as I looked at him, his eyes sparkling with mirth, I knew that he saw me – truly saw me – in a way no one else ever had.

"You know, I never realized how much joy a simple cup of coffee could bring until I saw it through your eyes," I said, my voice barely above a whisper.

Will's smile softened, and he leaned in, his lips brushing against mine. "That's because you're my favorite coffee buddy, and my favorite everything else, too."

As we sat there, surrounded by the memories we'd made, I knew that these candid photos were more than just a collection of funny moments – they were a testament to the love we shared, and the beauty of our everyday moments, captured through the lens of Will's loving gaze.

writing_prompt: A mischievous makeup artist convinces their reluctant partner to star in a video, only to reveal a hilariously unexpected transformation—what happens next?
story:
"Come on, it'll be fun! You can be my canvas, and I'll make you a masterpiece—or at least a meme," Nico said, his eyes sparkling with mischief as he gazed at his partner, Will. They were in their cozy little apartment, surrounded by Nico's makeup collection, which was roughly the size of a small mountain range.

Will raised an eyebrow, clearly unconvinced. "I don't know, Nico. I'm not exactly the next big thing in makeup tutorials."

Nico pouted, his lower lip jutting out in an exaggerated expression of disappointment. "But it'll be a great opportunity for you to try something new! You always say you want to be more adventurous."

Will snorted. "I didn't mean becoming a human rainbow."

Nico's grin returned, wider than ever. "Oh, but that's the best part! Trust me, you'll be a stunning rainbow. Now, sit down and let me work my magic."

With a resigned sigh, Will plopped down in the chair, and Nico got to work. The room was soon filled with the sound of Nico's chatter and the rustling of makeup bags as he worked his magic.

As the minutes ticked by, Will's face transformed into a riot of colors, each shade more outrageous than the last, shimmering under the lights like a kaleidoscope. Nico stepped back to admire his handiwork, a triumphant smile spreading across his face.

"Ta-da!" he exclaimed, as Will's eyes widened in shock.

Will's face was a canvas of chaos and color, with swirling patterns of blue, green, and yellow that seemed to shift and shimmer in the light. He looked like a cross between a disco ball and a clown, and Nico couldn't help but burst out laughing.

Will's initial reaction was one of horror, but as he caught sight of Nico's infectious grin, his expression softened. "I look like a walking art exhibit," he said, his voice laced with amusement.

Nico chuckled, wiping tears from his eyes. "That's the idea! You're a masterpiece, my love."

As Will stood up, the room erupted in laughter, and he struck a pose, his face a canvas of chaos and color. Nico rushed over to grab his phone, snapping a photo that would undoubtedly go viral faster than a cat video on TikTok.

"I'm going to kill you," Will said, laughing, as Nico posted the photo online.

But as they both scrolled through the comments, Will's initial reluctance melted away, replaced by a sense of pride and ownership. He adjusted his new look in the mirror, a resigned smile spreading across his face.

"Okay, okay, I admit it. You got me. But only because you look so happy," he said, turning to Nico with a grin.

Nico's eyes sparkled with delight. "That's all that matters, my love. Now, let's take some more photos and make this video go viral!"

As they spent the rest of the evening laughing, taking photos, and basking in the glow of their online fame, Will couldn't help but think that maybe, just maybe, being a human rainbow wasn't so bad after all.

writing_prompt: While navigating the Labyrinth, Nico encounters a strange, freckled boy claiming to be from the future—and his future boyfriend.
story:
Nico trudged through the Labyrinth, his flashlight casting eerie shadows on the walls. He had been walking for what felt like hours, with no end in sight. Suddenly, he heard footsteps behind him.

"Hey, watch where you're going, time traveler," a voice said, followed by a faint chuckle.

Nico spun around, his eyes narrowing at the stranger. "I'm not a time traveler," he said, hand on the hilt of his sword.

The boy, with a mop of messy brown hair and a smattering of freckles across his cheeks, grinned. "Oh, I think you are, Nico di Angelo. At least, you will be."

Nico raised an eyebrow. "What are you talking about?"

"I'm from the future," the boy said, his eyes sparkling with amusement. "And I'm here to tell you that you're going to fall in love with me."

Nico's jaw dropped. "Excuse me?"

The boy nodded enthusiastically. "Yep. I'm your future boyfriend. Isn't that wild?"

Nico blinked, his mind reeling. "What? No. That's not how this works. You can't just show up and claim to be my future boyfriend."

The boy chuckled. "Actually, I can. I've been sent to...ah, let's call it ' prep you' for our future together."

Nico's skepticism was evident. "Sent by who?"

"By the Fates, of course," the boy replied, as if it was the most obvious thing in the world.

Nico threw up his hands. "This is ridiculous. I don't believe you."

The boy shrugged. "Suit yourself, but I've got proof. Want to see?"

Nico hesitated, curiosity getting the better of him. "Fine. Show me."

The boy grinned and pulled out a small device from his pocket. It looked like a smartphone, but with a strange glow emanating from the screen.

"What is that?" Nico asked, intrigued.

"A temporal comms device," the boy explained. "It lets me communicate with my past self – or in this case, my future boyfriend."

Nico raised an eyebrow. "You're talking to your past self?"

The boy nodded. "Yeah, it's a long story. But basically, I've been sending messages to my past self, trying to get us to meet earlier. And now, here we are."

Nico's mind was spinning. This was either the most elaborate prank he'd ever seen or...or something else entirely.

The boy began to scroll through the device, showing Nico messages and photos from a future life they'd supposedly shared. Nico's eyes widened as he saw pictures of them together, holding hands, laughing, and kissing.

"Whoa, slow down," Nico said, feeling overwhelmed.

The boy chuckled. "Sorry, sorry. I get carried away. But I promise, it's real. We're meant to be, Nico."

Nico took a deep breath, trying to process everything. This was either the most ridiculous thing he'd ever heard or...or something he couldn't quite explain.

As he looked into the boy's eyes, he saw something there, something that made his heart skip a beat.

"Why me?" Nico asked, his voice barely above a whisper.

The boy smiled. "Because, Nico di Angelo, you're the only one who can make me feel like I'm home."

Nico's heart skipped another beat. He didn't know what to say, what to think. But as he looked at the boy, he felt a spark of connection, a sense of possibility.

Maybe, just maybe, this was real.

"Okay," Nico said finally, his voice barely above a whisper. "I'll listen."

The boy grinned, his eyes sparkling. "That's all I can ask for."

As they stood there, surrounded by the Labyrinth's eerie silence, Nico felt a sense of wonder, of excitement. He had no idea what the future held, but with this strange, freckled boy by his side, he was willing to take a chance.

writing_prompt: After surviving the horrors of Tartarus, Will and Nico have developed quiet rituals to soothe their lingering fears. One sleepless night, they find themselves dancing in the kitchen, holding each other close as the weight of their shared past fades into the rhythm of the present.
story:
The soft glow of the kitchen lights cast gentle shadows on the walls as Will and Nico swayed to the music, their bodies entwined in a slow dance. The air was thick with the faint aroma of chamomile tea, a calming scent that seemed to seep into their pores, soothing the lingering fears that still lingered from their time in Tartarus.

Nico's eyes, usually serious and guarded, sparkled with a rare glint of amusement as Will's feet stumbled over his own. "You're going to step on my toes, Solace," Nico teased, his voice low and husky.

Will chuckled, his eyes crinkling at the corners. "Hey, I'm just trying to keep up with your fancy demigod moves, di Angelo."

Nico snorted, his laughter bubbling up like a rare and precious gem. "Fancy? You're the one who's been practicing your 'dancing skills' in front of the mirror, Solace."

Will's face flushed, but he just grinned, pulling Nico closer. "Hey, someone's got to keep the monsters at bay with their sweet dance moves."

As they twirled across the kitchen, the music wrapped around them like a comforting embrace. It was a pop song, something upbeat and silly, but it was a favorite of theirs, a reminder of the small joys they'd found in each other's company during the darkest of times.

Nico's thoughts began to wander, his mind slipping back to the depths of Tartarus, where the darkness had seemed to swallow them whole. But as he looked into Will's eyes, he felt the weight of their past slip away, like sand trickling through his fingers. He held onto Will, feeling the warmth of his skin, the beat of his heart, and the gentle rhythm of their dance.

We're safe now, Nico thought, the words repeating like a mantra in his mind. We're safe, and we're together.

As the music swelled, Nico's grip on Will's waist tightened, his fingers digging into the soft fabric of his shirt. Will didn't flinch, just smiled and pulled him closer, their bodies swaying in perfect sync.

In this moment, they were just two people, lost in the music and each other. The horrors of Tartarus, the battles they'd fought, the scars they'd earned – all of it faded into the background, leaving only the gentle thrum of the present.

As the song drew to a close, Will leaned in, his lips brushing against Nico's ear. "You know, di Angelo, I think we make a pretty good team."

Nico's heart swelled, his eyes drifting shut as he let the warmth of the moment wash over him. "We do, Solace. We do."

The music faded, leaving only the soft hum of the kitchen lights and the sound of their own ragged breathing. Will and Nico stood there, entwined, the weight of their shared past slowly lifting, like the morning fog that burned off in the sun.

In the silence, Nico felt a sense of peace settle over him, a sense of belonging to this moment, to this person, to this fragile, beautiful life they'd built together. He knew that the darkness would always linger, waiting to pounce, but in this moment, he felt the light was stronger, a beacon that shone bright in the darkness.

And as they stood there, wrapped in each other's arms, Nico knew that they would face whatever came next, together, their hearts beating as one.
